[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The BADCamp System (BCS) defines requirements for managing event registrations, session submissions, and sponsorships.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BCS manages approvals, sponsorships, and schedules.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BCS integrates with Stripe, email services, and external APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BCS provides workflows for event registrations and sponsor management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BCS operates on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BCS supports REST APIs for data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: BCS optimizes storage for event data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: BCS supports multilingual content and regional scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: BCS links to sponsor systems, repositories, and indexing tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BCS handles registrations, approvals, and sponsorships.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: BCS serves sponsors, attendees, coordinators, and admins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: BCS depends on third-party services such as Stripe and email systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: BCS requires compliance with GDPR and PCI DSS.

[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations.PCI DSS: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Stripe for secure payment processing.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide APIs for session management and sponsorship tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support automated email notifications for registrations and event updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to register and create accounts.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support session proposal submissions and approvals (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage sponsor profiles, payment tracking, and tier-based benefits (REQ-DSGN-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall generate personalized event schedules for attendees.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process session approvals within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 5,000 concurrent users without performance degradation (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user profiles, session data, and sponsorship details in a relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain a history of session submissions, approvals, and payments.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for user data privacy and protection.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt transactions and communications.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to PCI DSS for payment security compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control for event administrators and sponsors.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime with failover mechanisms.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests approvals, sponsor workflows, and performance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: API specifications, system diagrams, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Stripe API, GDPR standards, and PCI DSS security requirements.
